name: CPUC Energy Savings Assistance (ESA) Program
description: Free home upgrades and repairs including heat pump water heaters, furnaces, lighting, refrigerators; all at no charge for income-eligible customers
fullDescription: The Energy Savings Assistance Program provides free home energy upgrades and weatherization services to income-qualified households, helping reduce energy bills and improve comfort.
whatTheyOffer:
- Free energy assessment of your home
- LED lighting upgrades
- New energy-efficient refrigerator
- Weatherization (insulation, caulking, weather stripping)
- HVAC repairs or replacement
- Heat pump water heater installation
- Smart power strips
- All services and equipment at no cost
howToGetIt:
1. Check income eligibility (typically 200% federal poverty level)
2. Contact PG&E to request free assessment
3. Technician visits home to evaluate needs
4. Receive free installation of qualifying upgrades
5. Renters and homeowners both eligible
6. May qualify through CARE enrollment
keywords: ESA, Energy Savings Assistance, free, weatherization, LED, refrigerator, PG&E, insulation, low-income, home upgrade
